label: Leaves Bag End
quote: The Road goes ever on and on, down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, and I must follow, if I can.

label: Bucklebury Ferry
quote: Short cuts make long delays, but inns make longer ones. The Shire lay behind them now — quiet fields giving way to mist and uncertainty.

label: Tom Bombadil's House
quote: Old Tom Bombadil is a merry fellow — bright blue his jacket is, and his boots are yellow. Eldest, that's what I am. Tom remembers the first raindrop and the first acorn.

label: Arrives at Bree
quote: All that is gold does not glitter, not all those who wander are lost. The old that is strong does not wither — deep roots are not reached by the frost.

label: Weathertop
quote: They have drawn too much attention to themselves. The Nazgûl are abroad — nine riders in black, and the hill of Amon Sûl offers no true shelter from the Enemy's gaze.

label: Ford of Bruinen
quote: If you want him, come and claim him! The power of the Elven-lord flooded the river, and white horses of foam rose in fury against the Nine.

label: Rivendell
quote: The Last Homely House East of the Sea. His house was perfect, whether you liked food, or sleep, or work, or story-telling, or singing, or just sitting and thinking best, or a pleasant mixture of them all.

label: Leaves Rivendell
quote: The Company of the Ring shall be Nine — and the Nine Walkers shall be set against the Nine Riders. You shall be the Fellowship of the Ring.

label: Caradhras
quote: There is a fell voice on the air. Caradhras the Cruel has not forgiven the races of old for the wounds they dealt his roots, and the mountain will not suffer their passage.

label: Moria Gate
quote: Speak, friend, and enter. The Doors of Durin, Lord of Moria — built by the craft of Celebrimbor in the days when Eregion and Khazad-dûm were bound in friendship.

label: Exits Moria
quote: You cannot pass! I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. The dark fire will not avail you, flame of Udûn. Go back to the Shadow!

label: Lothlórien
quote: The heart of Elvendom on earth. In this place, time does not wither the golden leaves, and the memory of the Elder Days lives still beneath the mellyrn.

label: Leaves Lothlórien
quote: I give you the light of Eärendil, our most beloved star. May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.

label: Parth Galen
quote: The lawn of Parth Galen lay shimmering, and the Argonath towered behind them — the Pillars of the Kings, carved in the likeness of Isildur and Anárion in the days of Gondor's might.

label: Breaking of Fellowship
quote: I would have gone with you to the end, into the very fires of Mordor. I know. Look after the others, especially Sam. He will not understand.

label: Emyn Muil
quote: This is the way in — a labyrinth of razor-sharp rocks, where even the air tasted of stone and weariness. Somewhere behind, a creature followed.

label: Dead Marshes
quote: Don't follow the lights. There are dead things — dead faces in the water. All dead, from battles long ago. Men and Elves and Orcs, the marshes had swallowed them all.

label: Black Gate
quote: The Black Gate is closed. The strength of the gate lies not in stone or iron, but in the will of Sauron — and none may pass who do not serve the Dark Tower.

label: Ithilien
quote: The garden of Gondor now desolate kept still a dishevelled dryad loveliness. It would have been a fair place once — before the Shadow crept eastward.

label: Captured by Faramir
quote: A chance for Faramir, Captain of Gondor, to show his quality. I do not wish for such triumphs. War must be, while we defend our lives — but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness.

label: Henneth Annûn
quote: The Window of the Sunset. Here the last rangers of Gondor kept watch against the darkness, hidden behind a curtain of falling water that caught the dying light.

label: Cross-roads
quote: The old king's head — it was lying rolled away by the roadside. But look! The light of the setting sun crowned it with gold, and the eyes were calm.

label: Stairs of Cirith Ungol
quote: Up, up the great staircase they climbed. It was dark as the pits of Morgoth — carved by hands long vanished, in the days when Minas Ithil still gleamed with silver light.

label: Shelob's Lair
quote: There agelong she had dwelt, an evil thing in spider-form. She who was there before Sauron, before the first stone of Barad-dûr — Shelob, last child of Ungoliant.

label: Frodo Captured
quote: I'm going to get him, if I have to take all the tower down to the foundations. Don't go where I can't follow! Mr. Frodo!

label: Tower of Cirith Ungol
quote: In the tower, stripped of everything, Frodo lay in despair. The weight of the Quest pressed heavier than any chain the Orcs could forge.

label: Rescued by Sam
quote: I'm coming, Mr. Frodo! In that hour of darkness, the most unlikely hero found a courage beyond the measure of any tale.

label: Morgai Valley
quote: The land seemed full of creaking and cracking and sly noises. Even in the pits of Angband, Húrin had not felt a weariness so deep as this.

label: Plains of Gorgoroth
quote: A bitter, desolate land. No water, no green thing. The very air was a poisonous fume, and the ground burned beneath their feet.

label: Approaches Mount Doom
quote: Come, Mr. Frodo! I can't carry it for you, but I can carry you and it as well. So up you get! Sam's going to give you a ride.

label: Climbing Mount Doom
quote: The last stage of their journey had come. The Mountain loomed before them — Orodruin, the Fire-mountain, where once Sauron had forged the One Ring in the fires of its heart.

label: Sammath Naur (Summit)
quote: I have come. But I do not choose now to do what I came to do. I will not do this deed. The Ring is mine!

label: Ring Destroyed
quote: The eagles are coming! And into the heart of the storm, with a cry that pierced all other sounds, the Eagles of Manwë came from the ancient West.
